For how many of the following types of quadrilaterals does there exist a point in the plane of the quadrilateral that is equidistant from all four vertices of the quadrilateral?
\begin{itemize}
\item a square
\item a rectangle that is not a square
\item a rhombus that is not a square
\item a parallelogram that is not a rectangle or a rhombus
\item an isosceles trapezoid that is not a parallelogram
\end{itemize}
$\textbf{(A) } 1 \qquad\textbf{(B) } 2 \qquad\textbf{(C) } 3 \qquad\textbf{(D) } 4 \qquad\textbf{(E) } 5$
